The Elder Candanamāli’s Birth Story
“Having abandoned the five strands of sense pleasure,
which are dear and delightful,
having abandoned eighty koṭis,
I went forth into homelessness.
Having gone forth, with my body🔽I avoided bad actions,
having abandoned bad conduct by speech,
I lived on the bank of a river.
While I was living alone,
the best Buddha came to me;
I did not know he was the Buddha,
so I made hospitality offerings.
Having made hospitality offerings,
I asked about his name and family:
‘Are you a deity, a gandhabba,
or are you Sakka, the giver of men?

original: Ko vā tvaṁ kassa vā putto,
analyzed: kaḥ vā tvam kassa vā putto
translated: Who are you? Whose son are you?
Have you come here as Great Brahmā?
You shine in all directions,
like the rising sun.
Your feet have a thousand spokes,
Lord, they are seen.

original: Ko vā tvaṁ kassa vā putto,🔽kathaṁ jānemu taṁ mayaṁ;
analyzed: kaḥ vā tvam kassa vā putto  katham jānemu tam maya
translated: Who are you? Whose son are you?🔽How can we know you?
Tell us your name and family,
and remove our doubt.
I am neither a deity nor a gandhabba,
I am not Sakka, the giver of men;
I have no existence as Brahma,
I am the highest of them all.
I have passed beyond their sphere,
I have broken the bonds of lust;
Having burnt up all the defilements,
I have attained the highest enlightenment.’
Having heard his words,
I spoke this speech:
‘If you are the Buddha, all-knowing,
sit down, great sage.
I will worship you,
you who bring an end to suffering’;
Having spread out the Conqueror’s robe,
I gave it to the Teacher.
The Fortunate One sat down there,
like a lion in a mountain cave;
Quickly climbing the mountain,
I took a fruit of the mango tree.🔽The flower of the Sālakaliṅga,
and the very precious sandalwood;
Quickly gathering all that,
I approached the Leader of the World.
Having given the fruit to the Buddha,
I worshipped with the Sāla flower;
Having anointed with the sandalwood,
I bowed to the Teacher.
With a clear mind, joyful,
with vast joy,
The Victorious One sat down,
the Wise One, the Leader of the World.
He laughed at me,
as he was destroying my work.
‘By the gift of this fruit,
and by the incense and garland,
For twenty-five hundred eons,
he will delight in the world of the gods;
With a mind that is not inferior,
he will be a Vasavattī.
For twenty-six hundred eons,
he will go to a human existence;
He will be a Wheel-turning King,
with power over the four directions.
The city named Vehāba,
built by Vissakamma,
will be all of gold,
adorned with various jewels.
By this very method,
he will transmigrate through existences;
Everywhere he will be worshipped,
by gods and by humans.
In his last existence,
he will be a kinsman of Brahmā;
Having gone forth from the home life,
he will be one who has gone forth.
Having attained the higher knowledges,
he will be extinguished, without pollutants.’
Having said this, the Sambuddha,
the wise leader of the world,
while I was reflecting,
departed without hesitation.
By that well-done deed,
by the intention and aspiration,
Having left behind my human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
Having fallen from the Tusita heaven,🔽I was conceived in my mother’s womb.
I had no lack of wealth
in which womb I dwelt.
When I was in my mother’s womb,
food and drink and meals;
By my mother’s wish,
whatever she desired was produced.
When I was five years old,
I went forth from the household life;
When my hair was cut,
I attained perfection.
Searching for my past deeds,
I did not see them before me;
For three thousand eons,

analyzed: mama kammam anussari  namaḥ te purisa ajañña
translated: I remembered my deeds.🔽Homage to you, O Wise One,
homage to you, O Supreme One;
Having come to your teaching,
I have attained the unshakable state.
For three thousand eons,
I worshipped the Buddha;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements are burned away,
I dwell without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.
The four analytical knowledges,
I have done the Teacher’s bidding.”
